textContent:
I feel called to live a meandering life. A life like it was defined by Ticht Nat Han ... a life free from the pursuit of goals and material possession. As defined by Joseph Campbell... a life following your bliss..  as defined by Jesus.. heaven on earth. What I keep coming back to is meandering creates space for connection and fulfilment in the present. It creates the conditions for serendipity, for wonder for service for compassion for love. 

The paradigm shift is realizing that I'm trapped by feeling that I must give up everything we have today, that we need a big change to our lifestyle to make it happen and that until we have a plan that has thought about every variable we would be fools to try. That's my dreams too big fallacy unchecked by pragmatic reality. 

But a meandering life is available to us to learn and try right now today. That we have the opportunity to meander for an hour a day, or meander for a weekend or meander for a week break or meander for 3 week Vaca or even meander for a full summer. That we can learn our way into it... we can keep what we like about our lives we have today... the house, the furniture the food the routine while also shedding the oppression of big goals and big plans. We can learn our way into meandering by doing it. 

That idea feels incredibly liberating, empowering, exciting, freeing

And every idea of meandering starts and ends with meandering with you, side by side ❤️ which gives me confidence to meander because I made the most important choice of all... our partnership our marriage and our love of each other and meandering through life together

A few hours 
- Duck Egg
- Sidie Hollow
- Esofea
- Mississippi Valley conservancy sites 
- Kickapoo River 
- KVR
- Wild Cat Mountain 

A full day
Overnight
A long weekend 
A week
Two or more weeks 


Our ability to understand cause and effect gives birth to ideas of what we could have; which in turn leads to the concept of desire.
